results.adx_keywords: Impeachment;Presidential Election of 2024;Trump, Donald J;Greene, Marjorie Taylor (1974- );McCarthy, Kevin (1965- );Stefanik, Elise
results.byline: By Jonathan Swan, Maggie Haberman and Alyce McFadden
results.title: Trump Has Been Privately Encouraging G.O.P. Lawmakers to Impeach Biden
results.abstract: The former president has talked regularly with members of the House Freedom Caucus and other congressional Republicans who pushed for impeachment.

media.caption: Representative Marjorie Taylor Greene said she told former President Donald J. Trump that she wanted the impeachment inquiry to be “long and excruciatingly painful for Joe Biden.”

results.adx_keywords: Drugs (Pharmaceuticals);Colds;Drugstores;Influenza;your-feed-healthcare;Food and Drug Administration;Consumer Healthcare Products Assn
results.byline: By Christina Jewett and Roni Caryn Rabin
results.title: A Decongestant in Cold Medicines Doesn’t Work at All, an F.D.A. Panel Says
results.abstract: The agency now must decide whether products containing the ingredient, like some Sudafed and NyQuil products, should no longer be sold or perhaps give companies lead time to substitute other ingredients.

media.caption: If the F.D.A. orders the removal of phenylephrine, medicine makers warn that some versions of popular products like Tylenol, Mucinex and Benadryl might become scarce for a time.

results.adx_keywords: Poverty;Food Insecurity;Income Inequality;Tax Credits, Deductions and Exemptions;Child Tax Credits and Stipends;Federal Aid (US);Stimulus (Economic);Inflation (Economics);Health Insurance and Managed Care;United States Economy;Census Bureau;United States
results.byline: By Ben Casselman and Lydia DePillis
results.title: Poverty Rate Soared in 2022 as Aid Ended and Prices Rose
results.abstract: The increase in poverty reversed two years of large declines. Median income, adjusted for inflation, fell 2.3 percent to $74,580.

media.caption: Volunteers at Common Pantry, a nonprofit food pantry in Chicago. Poverty soared last year as living costs rose and federal programs that provided aid to families during the pandemic were allowed to expire.
media.copyright: Jamie Kelter Davis for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Glaciers;Global Warming;Mount Rainier (Wash)
results.title: The ‘Forever’ Glaciers of America’s West Aren’t Forever Anymore
results.abstract: Climate change is melting the ice on Mount Rainier. The environmental effects will be widespread, a Park Service study warned.

media.caption: The Nisqually Glacier on the southwestern slope of Mount Rainier.
media.copyright: Max Whittaker for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Cooking and Cookbooks;Content Type: Service;Food;Quarantine (Life and Culture);Food Contamination and Poisoning;internal-sub-only
results.title: The Food Expiration Dates You Should Actually Follow
results.abstract: The first thing you should know? The dates, as we know them, have nothing to do with safety. J. Kenji López-Alt explains.

results.title: Taylor Swift and Beyoncé Get Their Own Press Corps
results.abstract: Newspapers rarely assign a reporter to cover a single artist. But Swift and Beyoncé are cultural forces whose tours continue breaking records.

media.caption: Beyoncé’s Renaissance World Tour and Taylor Swift’s Eras Tour have broken records and moved fans to travel far and spend heavily.

results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;Content Type: Personal Profile;Romney, Mitt;Republican Party;Senate;Utah
results.title: Romney to Retire, Calling for a ‘New Generation’ Beyond Biden and Trump
results.abstract: The Utah Republican and 2012 G.O.P. presidential nominee, 76, said he would step aside to make way for younger leaders and strongly suggested that the president and former president should, too.

results.byline: By Mohammed Abdusamee, Vivian Nereim and Isabella Kwai
results.title: More Than 5,000 Dead in Libya as Collapsed Dams Worsen Flood Disaster
results.abstract: In a catastrophe recalling Hurricane Katrina, a heavy storm burst through dams to unleash their waters on the city of Derna, sweeping away entire neighborhoods.

results.title: A Fugitive’s Capture Brings Relief to a Corner of Pennsylvania
results.abstract: After escaping from a county jail last month, Danelo Cavalcante eluded hundreds of law enforcement officers for nearly two weeks.

results.adx_keywords: Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);Defense and Military Forces;Ships and Shipping;Russia;Ukraine;Crimea (Ukraine);Sevastopol (Ukraine)
results.byline: By Marc Santora and Andrés R. Martínez
results.title: Ukraine Strikes the Headquarters of Russia’s Black Sea Fleet in Crimea
results.abstract: The Russian Ministry of Defense said that it had shot down seven of 10 cruise missiles that Ukraine fired at the facility in the city of Sevastopol. The area hosts naval operations key to Moscow’s war efforts in Ukraine.

media.caption: Along the bay of Sevastopol in Crimea last year. Russia invaded Crimea in 2014, illegally annexed it and began building up military operations there.

results.adx_keywords: Suits and Litigation (Civil);Pensions and Retirement Plans;Shareholder Rights and Activism;News and News Media;Murdoch, Rupert;Murdoch, Lachlan;Lander, Brad;Fox Corporation;New York City;Oregon
results.title: Fox Sued by New York City Pension Funds Over Election Falsehoods
results.abstract: The funds accuse the Fox Corporation board of neglecting its responsibility to shareholders by leaving the company open to defamation lawsuits.

media.caption: Brad Lander, New York City’s comptroller, oversees the city’s five pension funds, which represent nearly 800,000 current and retired workers and are worth $253 billion.

results.byline: By Julian E. Barnes, Eric Schmitt and Thomas Gibbons-Neff
results.title: Russia Overcomes Sanctions to Expand Missile Production, Officials Say
results.abstract: Moscow’s missile production now exceeds prewar levels, officials say, leaving Ukraine especially vulnerable this coming winter.

results.abstract: The Saratoga Race Course has long been a big draw, but it’s not the only one in this small, walkable city with a ‘phenomenal quality of life.’

results.title: A Viable Alternative to Conventional Lawn? Cornell May Have Found One.
results.abstract: Cornell Botanic Gardens is testing sustainable options for replacing your backyard grass. The bonus: They don’t need to be cut more than twice a year.

media.caption: A successful alternative to the conventional lawn will incorporate serendipitous arrivals like the crooked-stemmed aster (Symphyotrichum prenanthoides), which made its way into the native lawn at Cornell Botanic Gardens, in Ithaca, N.Y.

results.title: McCarthy, Facing an Ouster and a Shutdown, Orders an Impeachment Inquiry
results.abstract: The move against President Biden, which Speaker Kevin McCarthy had been signaling for weeks, comes as some far-right House Republicans are irate over spending and threatening to depose him.

results.adx_keywords: Sharks;Lakes;Golf;Research;your-feed-science;your-feed-animals;Marine and Fisheries Science (Journal);Australia
results.title: Sharks on a Golf Course Made a Watery Grave Unlike Any Other
results.abstract: A group of bull sharks ended up spending 17 years in a lake by a golf course’s 14th hole, suggesting that the predators can live in low-saltwater environments indefinitely.

media.caption: A bull shark’s dorsal fin in a lake at Carbrook Golf Club in Brisbane, Australia, in 2012.
